block.p: Sarah Wells Newbery, a daughter of Jane Newbery and the Rev. Charles Newbery of Scarborough, Me., was married in Philadelphia yesterday to Garrett Stevens Finney, a son of Katharine and Graham Finney of Philadelphia. The bride's father, who retired as the rector at St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, N.Y., officiated at the home of Martha Finney, a sister of the bridegroom.

The bride, 33, and the bridegroom, 36, work for architecture firms in Houston. She is an architect at Curtis & Windham Architects, and he is the senior architect at Spacehab Inc., working at the Habitability Design Center of NASA and designing interiors for the international space station.

Sarah Wells Newbery, a daughter of Jane Newbery and the Rev. Charles Newbery of Scarborough, Me., was married in Philadelphia yesterday to Garrett Stevens Finney, a son of Katharine and Graham Finney of Philadelphia. The bride's father, who retired as the rector at St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, N.Y., officiated at the home of Martha Finney, a sister of the bridegroom.

The bride, 33, and the bridegroom, 36, work for architecture firms in Houston. She is an architect at Curtis & Windham Architects, and he is the senior architect at Spacehab Inc., working at the Habitability Design Center of NASA and designing interiors for the international space station.

The bride will continue to use her name professionally. She graduated from Yale University and received master's degrees in architecture and in landscape architecture from Harvard. Her father is a member of the steering committee of Episcopal Relief and Development. He and the bride's mother are also volunteers at the Volunteer Lawyers Project, a legal help line in Portland, Me.

The bridegroom graduated from Yale, from which he also received a master's degree in architecture. In 1994, he won the Rome Prize in architecture from the American Academy in Rome. His mother, who is retired, was a lecturer in English at the University of the Arts in Philadelphia. His father, who is now an independent management consultant, was the president and founder of the Conservation Company, a management consulting business in Philadelphia and New York.
